posts.name: Alex Hart
posts.cooked:
Weâ€™re releasing the Signal 7.65 beta soon. If youâ€™re interested in participating, join the beta group here.

Share your feedback on the latest changes:

â˜… Signal polls are here! Are you and your friends on the same page, or are you poll-ar opposites? Polls are an easy way to see what your group chat really thinks. Create a poll with competing dinner options, vacation destinations, musical preferences for an upcoming road trip, or any other important choices. Everyone in the group can vote and see each otherâ€™s responses, and you can decide whether or not to allow multiple votes.

Complete list of new commits since 7.64.2:
https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/compare/v7.64.2â€¦main

Thank you for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Comparing v7.63.3...main Â· signalapp/Signal-Android Â· GitHub
Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.64 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.65.0 (161500)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

48 new commits since 7.64.2:

Show commits

  • Fix notification profile export. [1]

  • Fix saved-state issue in TriggerAlignedPopup. [2]

  • Add reusable scaffold for recipient picker screens. [3]

  • Only write binary ids in staging. [4]

  • Only mark exported attachment as wasDownloaded if plaintextHash present. [5]

  • Enable split pane UI for new call screen. [6]

  • Fix see all button when viewing votes. [7]

  • Convert InternalStoryDialogLauncherFragment to Compose. [8]

  • Add debugging info around used disk space. [9]

  • Formatting. [10]

  • Formatting. [11]

  • Reduce error noise when failing to restore an attachment that was intentionally never uploaded. [12]

  • Remove excess bottom padding in landscape when using gesture navigation. [13]

  • Move RecipientPicker to recipients package. [14]

  • Display large local renderer in ongoing group call if no other users are joined. [15]

  • Add a DiskSpaceNotLowConstraint and use for automatic attachment restore. [16]

  • Add callbacks to tiny local video renderer. [17]

  • Inline large-screen internal setting and remove it. [18]

  • Convert WhoCanFindMeByPhoneNumber to StateFlow. [19]

  • Convert InternalDonorErrorConfigurationFragment to Compose. [20]

  • Implement CallParticiantsUpdatePopup in compose. [21]

  • Convert CallParticipantId to Kotlin. [22]

  • Refactor backup creation failures, add case for file too large. [23]

  • Update to libsignal 0.86.1 [24]

  • Fix edited message attachments stuck in download state. [25]

  • RTL fix for donations receipts. [26]

  • Do nothing if the error returned is SETUP_CANCELLED. [27]

  • Allow users to confirm link preview on text story before it loads. [28]

  • Reduce the timeout for the popup window and allow users to click to dismiss. [29]

  • Don't show 'Payment Pending' during backup subscription keep-alive flows. [30]

  • Ensure gift flow can be created from any fragment it's initialised in. [31]

  • Move all Pair usage to kotlin.Pair [32]

  • Fix possible NPE when dismissing emoji popup. [33]

  • Be a bit smarter about choosing our anchor to animate to. [34]

  • Minor poll UI fixes. [35]

  • Fix change number problems. [36]

  • Attempt backing up a subset of messages if you hit the limit. [37]

  • Avoid the possibility of double-exporting a recipient. [38]

  • Update to the latest backup tests. [39]

  • Prepare to show backups megaphone to beta users. [40]

  • Separate end poll strings. [41]

  • Enable sending of polls. [42]

  • Fix quotes of unsupported message. [43]

  • Fix missing group size limit warnings. [44]

  • Add error case for when you don't have enough disk space to create a backup. [45]

  • Better insets propagation. [46]

  • Update translations and other static files. [47]

  • Bump version to 7.65.0 [48]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Android v7.64.2â€¦v7.65.0

Localization changes

posts.name: AlertSubject
posts.cooked:
Thanks for adding polls, nicely done!

  1. When you add a lot of options, your view automatically scrows down - could the scrolling be animated? Right now itâ€™s a very jarring jump

  2. When voting, I feel like the whole row should be clickable, not just the left side - at least thatâ€™s what people are used to from WhatsApp

  3. Can we set automatic end dates during the creation of the poll? The option to end the voting is kind of hidden

  4. The chat preview says â€œsignal pollâ€ in cursive, only housekeeping notices, such as something being removed from a group are in cursive. Media, voice messages etc are not shown in cursive font

  5. When a vote ends the icon feels a little close to the bar and doesnâ€™t seem to align with the number correctly. The view results button could also be moved up slightly as to not come too close to the timestamp - see screenshot

  6. Will signal votes be released for 1:1 chats as well? Just wanted to send one to my friend and noticed the option isnâ€™t there

  7. Going back from â€œview resultsâ€ doesnâ€™t yet have the predictive back gesture enabled

1420101024Ã—934 46.3 KB

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.63 release

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: Cool! Os anonymous voting planned? Maybe something like how we can edit groups with zkproofs or something? An editable blob on the server like group descriptions?

When setting up cloud backups, Signal provides me with a recovery key and asks me to store it somewhere safe. Iâ€™m given the options of copying it to clipboard and I was surprised to see an option to save it to a password manager, which I selected. However, some google password manager popped up, which Iâ€™ve never used. I have both Proton Pass and Bitwarden installed and there is no option to save it to either of those.

I ended up copying it to clipboard and manually saving it to one of my actual password mangers.

posts.name: ðŸ‘ŠðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸ðŸ”¥
posts.cooked:
Itâ€™s the password managerâ€™s problem.

Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.56 release Android Beta Feedback
Bitwarden doesnâ€™t support saving passwords via CredentialManager, only passkeys (but that functionality should be available soon). Likely the same issue with Firefox - it may not have an implementation for saving passwords using CredentialManager, in which case any enabled password manager that supports that functionality will be used to handle the password save request instead.

Also applies to Proton.

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.56 release

posts.name: Tiwo Satriatama
posts.cooked:
Another overlap issue. Now, in the conversation screen. So, if you select the last chat bubble (which located at the very bottom of the screen), the bottom bar covers it up. Thereâ€™s no way to scroll up the screen on the first try

Debug log https://debuglogs.org/android/7.65.0/ed83ba52a611782b730229d8d0eea62b4c0aad808808e36244e94c429586f4bc

Screenshot_20251113_170333_Signal1080Ã—645 44.4 KB

Just two small issues I noticed playing with polls this afternoon:

  • When deleting a poll-message, the actual poll-data is not deleted from the database. Nothing is shown to the user of course (except the normal tomb stone), but when inspecting the database (from a backup), the poll is still there with its title and all poll options present. The poll I did this with did not have any votes cast, but Iâ€™m pretty sure those would also still be there.
  • When the poll does not allow multiple votes the subtitle says â€œSelect Oneâ€, with a capital â€˜oâ€™, this seems incorrect. For polls with multi-vote, the subtitle is â€œSelect one or moreâ€ (and finalized polls have similar capitalization).

Thanks!

bepaald:

  • When deleting a poll-message, the actual poll-data is not deleted from the database. Nothing is shown to the user of course (except the normal tomb stone), but when inspecting the database (from a backup), the poll is still there with its title and all poll options present. The poll I did this with did not have any votes cast, but Iâ€™m pretty sure those would also still be there.

  • When the poll does not allow multiple votes the subtitle says â€œSelect Oneâ€, with a capital â€˜oâ€™, this seems incorrect. For polls with multi-vote, the subtitle is â€œSelect one or moreâ€ (and finalized polls have similar capitalization).

Fixed!

posts.name: [Android and Windows Beta]
posts.cooked:
Thereâ€™s no option to edit poll questions or edit options. It would also be useful to set when the poll ends such as after a set time.

Also the location sharing should give an option to use openstreetmap or Google maps. Maybe use openstreetmap as a fallback option such as when Google play services are not installed.

Current beta works perfectly fine on a Samsung s10
